member.summary: Get or set an arbitrary object value that can be used to store custom information about this property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.AllowResetOnlyIfPropertyDescriptorCan
member.summary: When set to true, and AllowReset is not explicitly set, then when determining whether a property can be reset a check is always made with the underlying PropertyDescriptor's CanResetValue method. Default value is false, meaning an attempt is made to reset values even when PropertyDescriptor.CanResetValue is false. For more information, see MSDN.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.ShowSubProperties
member.summary: When set to a non-null value, directly overrides any other settings which affect whether sub properties are shown for this property, including PropertyGrid.ShowSubProperties and PropertyDefinition.ShowSubPropertiesOverride.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.RootProperty
member.summary: Gets the propety grid property which is at the root of this property, if this property is a sub property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.ParentCollection
member.summary: Access to the parent PropertyGridPropertyCollection of which this property is a member.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.ParentProperty
member.summary: Access to the parent property, if this is a sub property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.Property
member.summary: Access the underlying PropertyDescriptor.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.EditorDescriptor
member.summary: Get or Set an EditorDescriptor which provides services such as optional values for the property's editor. If unset at the time property grid item is loading, then the default EditorDesciptor will be used, determined by the property type, and obtained from the set of editor descriptors provided by parent property grid property DefaultEditorDescriptors.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.Validator
member.summary: If non-null, this object's Validate method is called when Value is being committed to the underlying property. If the new value is in error, then the Validate method returns a string describing the problem. Note that the new value is accessible via the Value property of the PropertyGridProperty which is sent in as parameter to Validate.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.ValidationCallback
member.summary: If non-null, the delegate will be executed prior to the new value being set on underlying property. Return string describing error or null if no error. Note that the new value is accessible via the Value property of the input parameter.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.Name
member.summary: Gets the property name.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.PropertyDefinition
member.summary: Access the effective PropertyDefinition for this property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.Show
member.summary: Get or Set whether the property is shown in the property grid. Setting false results in the property being removed from the parent property collection.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.IsSelected
member.summary: Gets whether this property is currently selected in the parent PropertyGrid.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.Target
member.summary: Get a reference to the Object which provides the backing for the property. Note that if this value is not null, then property Targets will be null and visa-versa.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.Targets
member.summary: Get a reference to the collection of objects which are targets of this property. In general cases, this list will match the SelectedObjects property of the parent property grid. Note that if this value is not null, then property Target will be null and visa-versa.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.HierarchyLevel
member.summary: Gets the level in the hierarchy of this property. Top level properties have HierarchyLevel == 0;

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.IsSubProperty
member.summary: Gets whether this property is the sub property of another property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.DisplayName
member.summary: Get or Set the name to display for this property. By default DisplayName is obtained from the underlying property descriptor's DisplayName value, and if that is not set, then DisplayName is set equal to Name.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.Category
member.summary: Get or Set the Category for this property. By default, Category is obtained from the underlying PropertyDescriptor.Category value.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.CategorySortString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string by which the property category is sorted. By default the return value is Category, but this may be overridden by setting the value explicitly.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.SortString
member.summary: Gets or sets the string by which the property is sorted in the property grid. By default, the return value is DisplayName, but this may be overridden by setting the value explicitly.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.Description
member.summary: Gets or Sets the description for this property. By default, Description is obtained from the underlying PropertyDescriptor.Description value.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.IsReadOnly
member.summary: Get or Set whether the property should be considered as read-only. By default this value is obtained from the underlying property descriptor's value for its IsReadOnly property. Explicitly setting this value to True will recursively set all sub property's IsReadOnly to true. Explicitly setting to false will recursively revert all sub property's to their underlying property descriptor's IsReadOnly value.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.IsNullable
member.summary: Gets whether the property is a Nullable.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.IsEditorInErrorState
member.summary: Gets whether the editor for this property is in an error state.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.PropertyType
member.summary: Gets or sets the Type of the property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.Value
member.summary: Get or Set the value of the property on the underlying object.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.SubProperties
member.summary: Get the sub properties of this property, if there are sub properties.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.TypeConverter
member.summary: Provides a means of specifying a custom TypeConverter for the property. By default, this value is obtained from the property descriptor of the underlying property.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.AllowReset
member.summary: Get or Set whether the Reset command should be enabled. Default value is true for non-ReadOnly properties if the property descriptor returns true for CanResetValue(..)

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridProperty.ResetCommand
member.summary: Gets or Sets an ICommand which when executed calls the Reset method. By default, returns a RelayCommand which calls Reset() when executed and calls GetCanReset() to determine if CanExecute is true.

member.name: T:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.PropertyGridPropertyCollection
member.summary: Defines a collection of PropertyGridItems to be displayed by the PropertyGrid. This class handles loading of the property grid items when ever the current object of the property grid changes. In use, the PropertyGrid has a single instance of PropertyGridPropertyCollection, and the collection items are reset each time the property grid's current/selected item is changed.

member.summary: Get or Set an array of possible values for the property. Note: the Type of this property is an array of objects, which ensures that arrays of all primitive types can be defined when this class is used as an Attribute.

member.name: P:DevComponents.WPF.Controls.SelectorEditorDescriptor.PossibleValuesSource
member.summary: Defines a Type which exposes a set of static properties each of which is a possible value. Examples are the classes FontWeights or FontStyles
